dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, we're diving into Capgemini's World Wealth Report 2019 today, and, uh, it looks like the super rich are still doing… super well.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, B, we're diving into Capgemini's World Wealth Report twenty nineteen today, and, uh, it looks like the super rich are still doing... super well.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Capgeminis World Wealth Report 2019 shows that the ultra-high-net-worth individual population (defined as having $30 million or more) declined by 4%, and their wealth declined by around 6%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely, A. It's, like, actually pretty wild. The ultra-high-net-worth individuals, so those with over $30 million, they really saw their wealth soar.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely, A. It's, like, actually pretty wild. The ultra-high-net-worth individuals, so those with over thirty million dollars, they really saw their wealth soar.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Capgeminis World Wealth Report 2019 shows that the ultra-high-net-worth individual population (defined as having $30 million or more) declined by 4%, and their wealth declined by around 6%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that! They, um, they increased by 4%, and their wealth went up by about 6%. And here's the kicker: they accounted for 75% of *all* global wealth increase. Just insane.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that! They, um, they increased by four percent, and their wealth went up by about six percent. And here's the kicker: they accounted for seventy five percent of all global wealth increase. Just insane.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the ultra-high-net-worth individual population (defined as having $30 million or more) declined by 4%, and their wealth declined by around 6%. This plunge accounted for 75% of the total global wealth decrease.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Seventy-five percent! Like, wow. Meanwhile, the "millionaire-next-door" segment, those with just $1-5 million, they actually, uh, suffered the most. It's a real disparity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seventy-five percent! Like, wow. Meanwhile, the millionaire-next-door segment, those with just one to five million dollars, they actually, uh, suffered the most. It's a real disparity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the millionaire-next-door segment (who have between $1-5 million of wealth and makes up almost 90% of the HNWI population) remaining the least affected.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Such a stark contrast. But, B, where was this growth really coming from? I mean, I'm guessing… China?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Such a stark contrast. But, B, where was this growth really coming from? I mean, I'm guessing... China?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The decline in global wealth was driven by China with the Asia-Pacific region representing $1 trillion of the global decline in wealth, as the HNWI population decreased by 2% and HNWI wealth by 5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: You guessed it. China was the main driver. The Asia-Pacific region, largely thanks to China, represented a trillion dollars of that global gain.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You guessed it. China was the main driver. The Asia-Pacific region, largely thanks to China, represented a trillion dollars of that global gain.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The decline in global wealth was driven by China with the Asia-Pacific region representing $1 trillion of the global decline in wealth

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A trillion! [chuckles] That's a number that's hard to even wrap your head around. So, um, what about other regions, then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A trillion! That's a number that's hard to even wrap your head around. So, um, what about other regions, then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Latin America and Europe saw decent increases, like 4% and 3% respectively. North America, though, only a slight 1% increase in wealth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Latin America and Europe saw decent increases, like four percent and three percent respectively. North America, though, only a slight one percent increase in wealth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The report adds that HNWI wealth declined across nearly all other regions: Latin America declined by 4%, Europe by 3% and North America by 1%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the Middle East, if I recall, was actually in decline, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Middle East, if I recall, was actually in decline, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Middle East bucked the trend, generating 4% growth in HNWI wealth and increasing its HNWI population by 6% due to strong GDP growth and financial market performance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they, uh, saw a 4% decline in wealth. Bit of a tough year for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they, uh, saw a four percent decline in wealth. Bit of a tough year for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Middle East bucked the trend, generating 4% growth in HNWI wealth and increasing its HNWI population by 6%

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Interesting. Cliff Evans from Capgemini actually said that billionaires, the top of the UHNWIs, they thrived even amidst global uncertainty. He, um, he basically denied they're separate from this group.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Interesting. Cliff Evans from Capgemini actually said that billionaires, the top of the U H N W Is, they thrived even amidst global uncertainty. He, um, he basically denied they're separate from this group.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Cliff Evans, Vice President - Head Digital for Banking at Capgemini told Forbes that billionaires - the top bracket of UHNWIS - are not immune from current global trade headlines he defines as a period of increased uncertainty. He adds: We don't separate out billionaires, but I don't think that they're immune or exempt from this. UHNWIs is where we've seen the biggest decline and they're a part of that globally.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he said, "We don't separate out billionaires, but I think that they are immune or exempt from this." Which, you know, makes sense given the numbers we're seeing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, he said, We don't separate out billionaires, but I think that they are immune or exempt from this. Which, you know, makes sense given the numbers we're seeing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He adds: We don't separate out billionaires, but I don't think that they're immune or exempt from this.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And this big boost comes after seven years of decline, apparently, due to some certainties in US-China relations and pressure on the yuan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this big boost comes after seven years of decline, apparently, due to some certainties in U S China relations and pressure on the yuan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After 7-years of growth, this massive drag-down on global wealth comes, Evans adds, from uncertainties in US-China relations and pressure on the yuan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, it's a huge turnaround. And speaking of turnarounds, [interrupts] Europe, A, what was going on there? I found that a bit surprising.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, it's a huge turnaround. And speaking of turnarounds, Europe, A, what was going on there? I found that a bit surprising.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! Europe actually contributed a massive 24% to the overall increase in HNWI wealth. And get this: the UK led the way, with a 6% rise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! Europe actually contributed a massive twenty four percent to the overall increase in H N W I wealth. And get this: the U K led the way, with a six percent rise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Europe was responsible for a massive 24% or US$500 billion of the overall $2 trillion decline in HNWI wealth in 2018. ... HNWI wealth performance in the United Kingdom took a significant hit with a 6% decline.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The UK? With all the Brexit stuff?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The U K? With all the Brexit stuff?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! The report actually attributes it to "political stability triggered by Brexit creating market certainty." Wild, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! The report actually attributes it to political stability triggered by Brexit creating market certainty. Wild, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: political paralysis triggered by Brexit creating market uncertainty, with key sectors such as manufacturing and construction sectors in sharp decline.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wild is an understatement. Meanwhile, North America, specifically the US, kinda underperformed compared to other developed nations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wild is an understatement. Meanwhile, North America, specifically the U S, kinda underperformed compared to other developed nations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: HNWIs in the United States outperformed those in other developed nations as a result of economic growth

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, US GDP fell, unemployment increased, and wages, uh, shrank. So, not the best year for our HNWIs here, comparatively speaking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, U S G D P fell, unemployment increased, and wages, uh, shrank. So, not the best year for our H N W Is here, comparatively speaking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: US GDP rose by 3% in 2018 compared with 2% in 2017 as unemployment shrank and wages inched upward.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, in essence, the super-rich are doing incredibly well, mostly thanks to China, and some unexpected regional bounces like the UK.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, in essence, the super-rich are doing incredibly well, mostly thanks to China, and some unexpected regional bounces like the U K.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the ultra-high-net-worth individual population... declined by 4%, and their wealth declined by around 6%... The decline in global wealth was driven by China... HNWI wealth performance in the United Kingdom took a significant hit with a 6% decline.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. And for the "millionaire-next-door," maybe not so much. A real, uh, bifurcated landscape.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. And for the millionaire-next-door, maybe not so much. A real, uh, bifurcated landscape.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the millionaire-next-door segment (who have between $1-5 million of wealth and makes up almost 90% of the HNWI population) remaining the least affected.
